Transcription for 1002416

If you'll remain standing, we'll sing the Star-Spangled Banner.
Boy, they give it one note.
Oh, say can you see by the dawn's early light, What so proudly we hailed at the twilight's last gleaming,
Whose bright stars and bright stars through the perilous fight,
O'er the ramparts we watched, and the bombs bursting in air,
And the bombs bursting in air, O'er the ramparts we watched, and the bombs bursting in air,
O'er the ramparts we watched, and the bombs bursting in air,
O'er the land of the free and the home of the brave.
Thank you very much.
